meanings.definition: To attract or tempt by offering pleasure or advantage.
meanings.sent1: The smell of freshly baked cookies entices me to come into the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The colorful advertisement entices customers to visit the store.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise party entices me, but I hope I'm not the one being surprised!
meanings.sent4: The sparkling jewelry in the display case entices shoppers like a magnet.
meanings.sent5: The promise of a fun vacation entices families to plan their trip eagerly.

meanings.definition: To lure or persuade someone to do something by offering something desirable.
meanings.sent1: The salesman entices customers with a special discount on the latest model.
meanings.sent2: The teacher entices students to participate in the science fair with exciting prizes.
meanings.sent3: The cat entices the dog to chase it around the yard, creating a playful scene.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of sizzling bacon entices even the pickiest eaters to the breakfast table.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new bike entices children to save up their allowance money.
